results.title: The legacy of Len Lye
results.brief_description:
Tyler Cann talks about the works on display in the Len Lye exhibition at ACMI and the legacy of an extraordinary artist. Tyler Cann is the Curator of the Len Lye Collection at the Govett-Brewster Art Gallery, New Zealand.
Interview recorded in July 2009.

results.title: [Churchill Island]
results.brief_description: No title or credits available. An overview of the history of Churchill Island which was purchased by the Victoria Conservation Trust in January 1976 to be kept for the people of Victoria. It is a small island in size, yet large in both historical and conservation significance. Situated in Westernport Bay near Phillip Island, Churchill Island was first discovered on 5th January, 1798 by George Bass. A detailed booklet accompanies this film.

results.title: Getting the message
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Dramatization of the difficulties faced by an illiterate adult in employment and social situations. Suggests that with concern and adequate teaching methods this problem can be overcome. The film highlights the plight of the hundreds of illiterate Australian adults.

results.title: Jubilee and beyond
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: A non-narrated impression of the Royal visit to Melbourne, in the Queen’s Jubilee year, in 1977. Showing behind the scene preparations by the Army and Navy personnel, news crews, teachers and school children. The actual event is intercut with students from McRobertson Girls High School and Melbourne High School conducting a debate about the role of the Monarchy in Australia, touching on the issue of republic as an alternative. A good discussion starter on a ‘hot’ issue. (Includes shot of the half-built Westgate Bridge and Melbourne city skyline).

results.title: Hollywood Costume: What is Costume Design? with Prof. D. Nadoolman Landis
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Richard Greenhalgh, Kim Montgomery and ACMI

video_links.name: Hollywood Costume: What is Costume Design? with Prof. D. Nadoolman Landis

results.brief_description:
In a special event held at ACMI as part of the ‘Hollywood Costume’ exhibition, curator Professor Deborah Nadoolman Landis introduced the art of costume design and discussed its role in cinematic storytelling.
Landis, an Oscar®-nominated Hollywood costume designer (‘Raiders of the Lost Ark’, ‘The Blues Brothers’, Michael Jackson’s ‘Thriller’) is also the author of ‘Hollywood Costume’ (2012), the prize-winning exhibition catalogue, and ‘Hollywood Sketchbook: A Century of Costume Illustration’ (2012) among many other volumes.
Landis received her Ph.D. from the Royal College of Art in London and is the Founding Director of the David C. Copley Center for Costume Design at the UCLA School of Theater, Film and Television.
results.title_for_label: Hollywood Costume: What is Costume Design? with Prof. D. Nadoolman Landis

results.title: The Secondary Teacher
results.creator_credit: E.J. Perry and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Describes the life of secondary student teachers in training: accommodation in a boarding house in Armadale, Victoria, for those from the country areas; Melbourne University and the various courses available for students. Also gives details about specialised couses and shows classes in progress. Shows the science, commerce, music and engineering faculties. Narrated by Terry Dear and animation by the Owen Brothers.

results.title: Hollywood Costume: Deborah Nadoolman Landis interview
results.creator_credit: Sam Mapplebeck, Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI

video_links.name: Hollywood Costume: Deborah Nadoolman Landis interview

results.brief_description:
Professor Deborah Nadoolman Landis, an Oscar nominated Hollywood costume designer (‘Raiders of the Lost Ark’, ‘Blues Brothers’, Michael Jackson’s ‘Thriller’) is the author of ‘Hollywood Costume’ (2012), the prize-winning catalogue for the exhibition, and ‘Hollywood Sketchbook: A Century of Costume Illustration’ (2012) among many other volumes. Landis received her Ph.D. from the Royal College of Art in London and is the Founding Director of the David C. Copley Center for Costume Design at the UCLA School of Theater, Film and Television.
In this interview she talks about the origins of the Hollywood Costume industry, working as a costume designer, what a costume designer does and the relationship between the director and the costume designer.

In this interview she talks about the origins of the Hollywood Costume industry, working as a costume designer, what a costume designer does and the relationship between the director and the costume designer.

results.title: Louder than words
results.brief_description: A documentary about contemporary performance poetry featuring the work of Melbourne poets Ania Walwicz, Eric Beach and Jas H. Duke. They perform in their own exuberant, idiosyncratic and sometimes bizarre way a selection of their own works.

results.title: Romance calling: the forgotten city
results.brief_description: Film tells of the discovery of Angkor Thom, “the forbidden city” in Indo China and of its previous civilisation, showing ruins of this now extinct city.
